business.headline: Dreamliner aircraft saw 31 faulty deployment of emergency turbine in 14 yearsBoeing's Dreamliner aircraft reported 31 instances of faulty deployment of Ram Air Turbine, which is deployed automatically in the eventuality of a dual engine failure or total electric or hydraulic failure.

Wasting your credit card reward points? Here's how to track and redeem smartlyMost people use their credit cards daily but forget one key benefit — reward points. These points can fetch you free flights, hotel stays, or cashback, but only if tracked and redeemed wisely. Here's how to make every swipe count.
Sensex ends 130 points higher, Nifty above 25,800; Infosys up 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 130.06 points to end at 84,556.40, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 22.80 points to close at 25,891.40.

HUL shares rise nearly 3% after Q2 results and dividend announcementHUL shares have been on a steady uptrend in recent months. Over the last six months, the stock has gained 8.03%, while it has risen 3.81% in the past month and 1.84% in the last five trading sessions.

Is your savings account on tax radar? 7 bank transactions that raise red flagsYour savings account might not be as private as you think. Certain transactions can draw the tax department's attention and trigger scrutiny.

Oil prices surge 3% as India rethinks Russian crude purchases: ReportIndia, which has been the largest buyer of discounted Russian oil since 2022, imported around 1.7 million barrels per day in the first nine months of this year. However, the latest sanctions could now force Indian companies to shift to other suppliers.

Gold and Silver prices today: Check rates, future outlook, key support levelsGold and silver prices fell after record highs as investors booked profits. Easing geopolitical risks, a stronger dollar, and US–India trade optimism weigh, though long-term trends remain bullish.

Bitcoin stuck around $108K. Is the crypto rally fading?Bitcoin, the world's largest and most popular cryptocurrency, has slipped by nearly 1.94% over the past week and was trading around $108,922 at the time of writing. Ethereum, its closest rival, also fell by 3.57% in the same period.
Did Trump get this one right? Report claims India to slash Russian oil buysThe country's top private buyer of Russian oil, plans to significantly cut or completely halt its crude imports from Moscow.

Infosys, HCLTech, TCS: Why are IT stocks rising today?Infosys, HCLTech, and TCS stocks rallied today on the BSE and NSE, driven by India–US trade optimism, Infosys' record buyback, strong Q2 earnings expectations, and renewed investor confidence.

ITR refund still pending? Check your status online and know the reasons for delayWhile many taxpayers have already received their refunds, a few are still waiting for the amount to reach their bank accounts. If you haven't received yours yet, here's how you can track your refund online and find out what might be causing the delay.

Sensex, Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs: Will festive rally continue on Dalal Street?Sensex and Nifty hit fresh 52-week highs, fueled by festive optimism, trade deal hopes, and strong domestic and FII inflows. Key sectors like IT, pharma, and textiles are leading gains.

Gold, silver prices crash: Why are the precious metals under pressure?Gold and silver metals, which hit record highs earlier, have started to decline as investors book profits and shift back to assets such as equities.

Infosys shares rise over 4% today: What's driving the rally?Infosys shares jumped 3.2% to Rs 1,519.75 after announcing a record Rs 18,000 crore buyback. Promoters abstaining boosted investor sentiment, driving IT stock gains and strong market interest today.

Markets heading towards all-time high: Where should you invest now?After weeks of steady growth, benchmark indices are now showing signs of reaching fresh all-time highs, with investors looking for the next big opportunity.

Sensex jumps 800 points: Why is the stock market rising today?Markets rally as Sensex and Nifty climb on trade deal optimism. IT, pharma, textiles lead gains. Will the festive momentum sustain or face volatility? Traders remain watchful.

Sensex, Nifty rise further as reports hint at positive India–US trade dealThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 571.48 points to 84,997.82 around 9:25 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading above 26,000. Broader market sentiment also remained upbeat, supported by steady global cues and sustained domestic optimism.

Will Sensex, Nifty touch record highs today amid festive momentum?India's retail industry recorded its biggest-ever festive season sales this year, with Diwali business touching Rs 5.40 lakh crore in goods and Rs 65,000 crore in services.
Will gold and silver prices fall more today after the recent crash?Gold had fallen the most in over a decade on Tuesday, while silver recorded its steepest one-day decline since February 2021.

Compliance norms for edible oil industry tightened, nationwide inspections plannedStakeholders have been urged to complete registration and begin monthly reporting without delay to support a robust, data driven edible oil supply chain.

entertainment.headline: Ba***ds composer Shashwat Sachdev collaborates with Oscar winner Hans Zimmer Music composer Shashwat Sachdev and Hans Zimmer joined hands to create the title theme track for the British series 'Virdee'. Sachdev described the experience as a blend of humility, pride, and soulfulness.
Chiranjeevi gets court protection over misuse of his name and image A Hyderabad court has barred the unauthorised use of Chiranjeevi's name, image, and film titles online.

Prabhas turns 46: Mahesh Babu, Rishab Shetty and others wish the pan-India star As pan-India superstar Prabhas celebrates his 46th birthday, the Telugu film industry poured in heartfelt wishes, celebrating the actor's humility, warmth, and enduring legacy.

Sarathkumar wants to act and shoot duet with Deepika after Dude success Actor R Sarathkumar playfully stated his desire to feature alongside Deepika Padukone. His humour-laced remarks and key role in 'Dude' has received a lot of attention among fans

Malaika Arora birthday: Kareena, Sonam, Kajol and others extend warm wishes Actors Kareena Kapoor, Sonam Kapoor and Kajol, among others, sent birthday wishes to Malaika Arora on Thursday. The actors posted throwback pictures and heartfelt notes for Malaika as she turned a year older.

Prithviraj Sukumaran returns to sets as 'i, Nobody' enters new production phase Prithviraj Sukumaran is back on the sets of 'i, Nobody' as the film begins a new schedule of shooting. A video of the actor's arrival in a Porsche 911 GT3 going viral.

Nikolaj Coster-Waldau spotlights Odisha's mangrove restoration in docuseries 'Game of Thrones' actor and UNDP Goodwill Ambassador Nikolaj Coster-Waldau spotlights Odisha's community-led mangrove restoration in the new season of his international documentary series. The series highlights local climate resilience efforts and global cooperation.

Kichcha Sudeep addresses Bigg Boss Kannada 12 halt, says the issue wasn't ours Bigg Boss Kannada faced an unexpected pause after environmental concerns shut down Jollywood Studios. Host Kichcha Sudeep later clarified on air that the issue had nothing to do with the show, thanking officials for their swift action in resuming production.

Kantara Chapter 1 BTS moments: Rishab Shetty shares 'thrill of calling the shots' Rishab Shetty shared behind-the-scenes glimpses of 'Kantara: Chapter 1', highlighting the thrill and challenges of simultaneously directing and acting.

Aneet Padda as Shakti Shalini: Here's why filmmaker Amar Kaushik chose the actor Director Amar Kaushik selected Aneet Padda to play the lead in 'Shalini', following her debut in 'Saiyaara'. The decision aims to inject youth and freshness into the Maddock Horror Comedy Universe's new project.

Tamil composer MC Sabesh dies at 68 in Chennai Composer MC Sabesh, known for the Sabesh-Murali composing duo, died on Thursday at age 68. Sabesh was recognised for his contributions to Tamil cinema as a composer and playback singer.

DDLJ's Pooja Ruparel is Sonakshi's cousin, wore Poonam Sinha's outfit in film DDLJ's Pooja Ruparel, who played Chutki, recently revealed that she is actor Sonakshi Sinha's cousin. The actor shared in a recent interview how her acting journey began and mentioned a memorable connection with Poonam Sinha.

Just Beena things: Rasika Dugal celebrates 5 years of Mirzapur 2, shares video Rasika Dugal celebrated five years of 'Mirzapur 2' by revisiting her fierce portrayal of Beena Tripathi and reflecting on her journey with the iconic series.

Prabhas' The Raja Saab new poster out, first single to drop soon The makers of the much-anticipated film 'The Raja Saab' on Thursday unveiled a new poster to mark actor Prabhas' birthday. The film is set for Sankranthi 2026 release.

BJP's Annamalai applauds Mari Selvaraj's Bison: History beautifully captured BJP leader Annamalai praised director Mari Selvaraj's 'Bison Kaalamaadan' for its emotional depth and social message. The film highlights the journey of Arjuna Award-winning Kabaddi player Manathi Ganesan and the societal challenges faced by rural youth.

Thamma's ending is treat for Stree fans, unleashes the deadliest villain of MDHCU 'Thamma' connects the dots between 'Stree' and 'Bhediya'. Its ending hides a chilling surprise for 'Stree' fans, revealing that the franchise's most feared villain may never have truly died.

Highest praise! Gulshan Devaiah applauded for Kantara by Air India crew at 35k feet Actor Gulshan Devaiah was warmly appreciated by Air India airline crew during a flight for his performance in Kantara: Chapter 1.  This rare gesture of recognition highlights the actor's impact and the film's success.

Kapil Sharma returns with Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2, promises double chaos, laughs Kapil Sharma returns with 'Kis Kisko Pyaar Karoon 2', a comedy sequel filled with matrimonial madness and cultural clashes, releasing on December 12, 2025. The film promises double the laughter with chaotic wedding antics and a fresh dose of humour, as teased by the quirky motion poster.

Chiranjeevi and Venkatesh unite for Anil Ravipudi's Mana Shankara Vara Prasad Garu Director Anil Ravipudi brings together two of Telugu cinema's biggest stars, Chiranjeevi and Venkatesh, promising a wholesome family entertainer.

general news.headline: Tejashwi Yadav's dare to NDA on Bihar CM face draws BJP's 'thugbandhan' jibeTejashwi Yadav was named the INDIA bloc's chief minister face on Thursday. In response, the BJP launched a blistering attack on the RJD leader, dismissing his promises as "empty rhetoric" and warning that Bihar would not return to the "dark era of Jungle Raj".

A 'fake' wife twist in Rajasthan SDM's petrol pump slap controversyThe incident at the petrol pump has put into the spotlight the controversial past of Rajasthan SDM Chhotu Lal Sharma, who has a history of suspensions, legal cases and domestic disputes.

Illegal immigrant trucker from India kills 3 in US. High on drugs, didn't brakeA 21-year-old Indian-origin trucker, Jashanpreet Singh, was arrested after he killed three people and injured four others in Ontario, California. Singh, who was under the influence of drugs, reportedly entered the US illegally in 2022. Another trucker who had illegally migrated from Punjab killed three people in a crash in August.

Retirement soon? Virat Kohli's gloves gesture after Adelaide duck sparks speculationAUS vs IND, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli raised his gloves to acknowledge the standing ovation from the Adelaide Oval crowd after being dismissed for a duck. While it appeared to be a poignant gesture following what could be his final international innings at one of his favourite hunting grounds, speculation over whether Kohli was hinting at retirement began swirling on social media on Thursday.

Who is Mukesh Sahani, Bihar's VIP who worked with SRK in Devdas?Mukesh Sahani may lead a small party, but after being named Mahagathbandhan's deputy CM face, he seems to have emerged as the bloc's VIP. The influence of Vikassheel Insaan Party (VIP) over Bihar's marginalised voters makes him a heavyweight in the alliance. Here's why naming Sahani the deputy CM face is smart politics.

IND vs NZ Live: Rain stops play in Navi Mumbai after India go past 300IND vs NZ live score Women's World Cup 2025: Jemimah Rodrigues has got her fifty off 38 balls as India are looking for a final flurry at the DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. Harmanpreet Kaur also needs to get into her groove.

Your grandpa came from India: Mehdi Hasan counters Nikki Haley's son on migrationNalin Haley, son of Republican leader Nikki Haley, has sparked controversy on social media after calling for an end to mass immigration. He also urged states to restrict H-1B visas. British-American journalist Mehdi Hasan countered, saying Haley's grandfather, Ajit Randhawa, had migrated from India to the US in 1969.

PM Modi's latest post pours cold water on possible meeting with TrumpPM Modi's decision to attend the ASEAN summit virtually means he is unlikely to have another opportunity to meet Donald Trump this year. The Prime Minister has been a regular feature at the annual summit.

Comedian's heartwarming post for Air India air hostess has Internet looking for PreetiComedian Aditi Mittal shared a heartwarming story about an Air India flight attendant named Preeti who comforted her during one of the toughest moments of her life.

Bureaucrat, petrol pump staff slap each other; wife alleges wink, lewd remarkA physical altercation took place between SDM Chhotu Lal Sharma and petrol pump workers in Bhilwara after an alleged incident involving the SDM's wife. The event led to arrests and a police investigation.

India limits content takedown powers to fewer officials after legal fight with XUnder the new rules, only bureaucrats at the rank of joint secretary or above and police officials serving as deputy inspector general or higher are authorised to issue such orders.

Who's paying? Comedian roasts Zohran Mamdani for dining at pricey NYC dinerZohran Mamdani, a self-described democratic socialist, has built a double-digit lead in public polls over poll rival Andrew Cuomo by relentlessly focusing on the cost of living in New York City. He has offered an ambitious agenda that includes freezing rent for millions of New Yorkers and making city bus service free, fuelled by increases in taxes on corporations and the wealthy.

Are we ready to talk about sex dolls in India?As AI and hyperreal sex dolls blur the lines between fantasy and fidelity, expert weighs in on how couples can navigate this new frontier of intimacy without losing trust or connection.

2nd ODI: Rohit Sharma's gritty 73 not enough as India lose series in AdelaideAustralia vs India, 2nd ODI: Rohit Sharma scored a gritty 73 while navigating challenging conditions, but it wasn't enough as Australia cruised to a comfortable victory in Adelaide. India suffered their first one-day defeat at Adelaide Oval in 17 years.
Ex-Niti Aayog CEO's BMW cars remark sparks buzz amid Lokpal tender rowThe former Niti Aayog CEO's post comes amid a furore over Lokpal's move to acquire high-end BMW 330 Li vehicles.

Bhopal Diwali horror: 125 injured, many lose eyesight in carbide gun explosionsA cheap Diwali toy turned deadly in Bhopal as carbide guns left scores injured, and several children lost their eyesight. Officials said over 150 cases were reported despite prior warnings.

Elon Musk's vision of a robot-driven future without workElon Musk predicts a near future where AI and robots replace all jobs, creating an era of abundance with universal high income. But is he aware of the profound tech, social and economic challenges?

Power over parity: Vote-bank arithmetic trumps caste survey logic in Bihar pollsPolitical parties have largely abandoned the idea of proportional representation based on Bihar's caste survey, instead allocating tickets to consolidate their core vote banks.

Tejashwi it is. Mahagathbandhan names CM face after weeks of wrangling UpdatesBihar elections: The Congress had so far refrained from projecting Tejashwi as the chief ministerial face despite the visible camaraderie between the RJD leader and Rahul Gandhi during the Voter Adhikar Yatra.

No $100,000 fee for F-1 to H-1B visa status change. Should Indian students relax?US clarification says the $100,000 H-1B visa fee applies only to new petitions filed from abroad. F-1 students inside the US changing to H-1B are mostly exempt from the fee. But amid developments like capped study durations, OPT scrutiny, and reports of campus racism, Indian students face a shrinking window to study and work in the US.

Jai Shree Krishna: Bill Gates greets Tulsi Virani in new Kyunki promo. WatchMicrosoft co-founder and philanthropist Bill Gates is confirmed to appear via video call in an upcoming episode of Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi. A new promo features a conversation between Gates and Smriti Irani's character, Tulsi.

sports.headline: PBKS appoint Sairaj Bahutule as new spin bowling coach before IPL 2026 Punjab Kings have announced Sairaj Bahutule as their new spin bowling coach, replacing Sunil Joshi ahead of the next IPL season. The move aims to reinforce PBKS's bowling strategy and further develop young talent as the team prepares for the upcoming IPL auction and 2026 campaign.

Adam Gilchrist pens nostalgic Adelaide Oval post for Rohit Sharma Adam Gilchrist shared a heartfelt with Rohit Sharma during India's Adelaide ODI against Australia. The tribute recalls their first meeting at Adelaide Oval and years of collaboration in the IPL with Deccan Chargers.

IND vs NZ: Smriti Mandhana closes in on all-time record with blazing hundred Smriti Mandhana edged closer to Meg Lanning's all-time record for hundreds in women's ODIs with her 14th century during the India vs New Zealand clash. Mandhana got to the landmark in just 88 balls.

End of the road for Virat Kohli? Fans divided on ODI future after Adelaide duckVirat Kohli's second straight duck in Adelaide has sparked a storm of reactions among fans. While some see it as a temporary slump, others believe it could mark the twilight of his ODI journey.

South Africa warn India with 8-wicket win vs Pakistan, level Test series 1-1PAK vs SA, 2nd Test: South Africa secured a commanding eight-wicket victory over Pakistan in Rawalpindi to level the Test series. The world Test champions ended a 17-year-wait and gained confidence before their tour to India next month.

Rohit Sharma wins praise for gritty knock despite slowest ODI fifty in 10 yearsAustralia vs India, 2nd ODI: Rohit Sharma struck his slowest ODI fifty in 10 years but earned praise for battling in tough conditions at Adelaide Oval. He was dismissed for 73 off 97 deliveries, while Virat Kohli fell for his second successive duck of the series.

Babar Azam returns to Pakistan T20I squad before World Cup; Rizwan still sidelinedPakistan recalled Babar Azam to T20Is, four months before next year's T20 World Cup. However, wicketkeeper-batter Mohammad Rizwan remains sidelined from the T20I squad. Pakistan play a T20I series against South Africa and a tri-series against Sri Lanka and Zimbabwe in October-November.

Watch: Rohit Sharma urges Virat Kohli to walk off after 2nd straight duck vs AUSAUS vs IND: Virat Kohli was dismissed for his second consecutive duck in India's second ODI against Australia in Adelaide. Rohit Sharma advised him to walk off and not opt for a review.

Under-fire India, aiming to revive campaign against feisty New ZealandIndia women face New Zealand in a must-win Women's World Cup encounter in Navi Mumbai. The outcome will decide their semi-final fate amid challenging weather and team form.

Virat Kohli bags back-to-back ducks, waves goodbye to fans at Adelaide OvalAustralia vs India, 2nd ODI: Virat Kohli's much-awaited Adelaide swansong ended in disappointment as the former captain was dismissed LBW for 0, registering back-to-back ducks in the three-match series.

Fans bash Gambhir again after Kuldeep Yadav snubbed from 2nd ODIAUS vs IND: Kuldeep Yadav was once again left out of India's playing XI for the second ODI against Australia in Adelaide, reigniting criticism of head coach Gautam Gambhir and captain Shubman Gill.

Golden Arm Gets New Stripes: Neeraj Chopra Now An Honorary Lieutenant Colonel In Indian ArmyThis special report covers Olympic gold medallist Neeraj Chopra being conferred the honorary rank of Lieutenant Colonel in the Indian Army. The ceremony, held in New Delhi, was attended by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Chief of Army Staff General Upendra Dwivedi. On receiving the honour, Chopra stated, 'This is more than an honour - it is a responsibility towards my country'. The recognition celebrates his exceptional achievements in athletics and his role as an inspiration to the youth. Chopra, who joined the army as a Naib Subedar on August 26, 2016, has been lauded as an icon of perseverance and national pride. This places him in a select group of Indian sports figures, including Abhinav Bindra and MS Dhoni, to receive such an honorary rank in the armed forces.

UCL: Liverpool and Chelsea relish goal-fest, Real Madrid edge JuventusLiverpool and Chelsea returned to winning ways with emphatic 5-1 victories, while Real Madrid continued their perfect Champions League run with a narrow 1-0 win over Juventus.

Women's World Cup: Harleen, Pratika, and India coach's confusing lack of clarityIndia women's cricket team head coach Amol Muzumdar has dismissed strike rotation concerns ahead of the upcoming fixture against New Zealand in the Women's World Cup 2025. Muzumdar was seen contradicting his viewpoint from earlier in the tournament.

2nd ODI Highlights: Short, Connolly help Australia edge past India, win seriesIndia (IND) vs Australia (AUS), 2nd ODI Highlights: Fifties from Matt Short, Cooper Connolly and a blitz from Mitchell Owen helped Australia win the match in Adelaide by two wickets and clinch the series. The Indian bowlers leaked runs after the 30th over and failed to contain the Aussie batters as Shubman Gill started his ODI captaincy tenure with a series loss.

Can Harmanpreet Kaur help India break the SENA jinx in New Zealand clash?India haven't won a Women's World Cup match against a SENA nation since Harmanpreet Kaur's iconic 171 against Australia. They'll have a chance to end that streak when they face New Zealand in Navi Mumbai on Thursday.

McGrath applauds world-class Sutherland, Gardner's rescue act against EnglandStand-in captain Tahlia McGrath lauds Sutherland and Gardner's world-class batting in a six-wicket win over England. Their unbeaten 180-run partnership showcased Australia's resilience and depth in the Women's World Cup.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
